page.title: 01GENERAL SURVEY
page.content: The area is pleasantly undulating,with many small villages and hamlets in or near the river valleys; particulary the Ash valley, which cut into the land.The upperchalk forms the main rock but it is covered by glacial drift, which becomes very sticky, as we soon find out in the school in the winter! There are also patches of gravel and London Clay in the Ash valley, the latter was used to make the bricks of Hadham Hall. The clays have allowed more surface drainage than is usual on chalk and have produced a heavy but fertile soil. On the east side of the Ash valley an unconformity occurs where Reading beds rest on chalk.
